title: Höpler 2014 Pannonica Red (Weinland Österreich)
description: Lots of fleshy black and red cherry fruit swishes on nose and palate. It is juicy fruit that firmly stands in the foreground on a fluid palate that has lovely, exciting tinges of white pepper spice. The body is fresh and light, the finish is refreshing and moreish.

title: Höpler 2015 Pinot Noir (Burgenland)
description: Gentle red cherry fruit appears on the nose and swishes across the juicy palate where tannins and freshness provide a frame for all the cherry abundance. This majors on delicious fruit but comes with a lovely grip.

title: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2016 Domaine des Nazins  (Brouilly)
description: Full of red cherries and succulent black plums, this ripe, soft wine comes from a privately owned estate that is followed by the producer. The wine is ripe, full in the mouth and ready to drink now.

title: Jean-Michel Dupré 2016 Vieilles Vignes de 1940  (Beaujolais-Villages)
description: These vines, planted by the current owner's family in 1940, give a richly concentrated wine. Its dense texture contrasts with generous black fruits and crisp acidity to make a warm, rich wine that is ready to drink.

title: Le Bocce 2014  Chianti Classico
description: Made with Sangiovese and 5% Canaiolo, this opens with aromas of iris, black-skinned berry and leafy underbrush. The juicy palate delivers black cherry, clove and white pepper alongside brisk acidity and polished tannins. Drink through 2021.

title: Ledson 2013 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)
description: Hugely concentrated in big blackberry and currant fruit, this wine also offers mountainous tannin weight and grip. Pencil shavings, bitter leather and tobacco and a sizable imprint of savory oak demand attention in the glass.

title: Les Frères Perroud 2016 Vieilles Vignes  (Brouilly)
description: This wine has the typical soft, round character of Brouilly although a good backdrop of tannins gives it shape. Coming from old vines, it has density as well as plenty of crisp black fruits. Drink this wine now.

title: Marrenon 2015 Doria White (Luberon)
description: Pretty white blossom and chalky mineral tones lend freshness to soft apple and pear in this full-bodied but elegant white wine. It's soft and rounded on the palate but balanced by delicate acidity and a lingering mineral finish.

title: Neethlingshof 2015 Pinotage (Stellenbosch)
description: Aromas of burnt popcorn, mocha, raspberry sauce and brambly all-fruit preserves lead the nose on this rich and decadent pour. The palate is similarly plush and inviting, with a satiny texture and pillowy tannins that provide subtle framing to the ripe black-fruit flavors. The rich finish entices with notes of berry compote and sweet spice.

title: Podere Ciona 2013 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)
description: Moist earth, game, menthol and dark spice aromas lead the nose. The earthy and spice aromas follow over to the linear palate along with tart sour cherry, orange zest and a hint of coffee bean. Firm acidity and dusty tannins provide the backbone.

title: Rogue Vine 2015 Grand Itata Red (Itata Valley)
description: Dusty floral aromas of raspberry and cherry are what Itata's natural red wines are all about. This blend of Cinsault with 10% País is plush and ripe on the palate. Lightly medicinal flavors of plum, currant, spice and sandalwood finish with a grabby feel.

title: Shooting Star 2015 Merlot (Lake County)
description: A deep color and potent aromas of blackberry and black currant are the first impressions from this full-bodied, firmly structured and well concentrated wine. They lead to a palate full of deep blackberry flavors, a nicely dry balance and mouth-filling texture.

title: Sileni 2016 Straits Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This wine is fruity in lime and passionfruit tones, with green bell pepper and a hint of salty minerality. The palate carries a chalky texture and well-balanced acidity, finishing with a zip of lime zest.

title: Silver Thread 2016 Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: Vibrant aromas of underripe peach and apple blossom focus around a core of lemon-lime on the nose. There's a roundness to the dry palate, where ample acidity outlines crunchy green apple and apricot. A clean saline note lingers on the finish.

title: Substance 2014 Me Vineyard Collection Stoneridge Vineyard Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: The aromas are light on first pour, opening up over time with notes of herb, cherry, wood spice and black licorice. The ripe currant flavors are a bit linear in style, but show polish and appeal, seeming ever so slightly dried out.

title: Colle Bereto 2015  Chianti Classico
description: Aromas of black-skinned berry, underbrush and a whiff of leather come together on this. The concentrated palate offers blackberry jam, tobacco and white pepper alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2023.

title: Campo alla Sughera 2014 Adeo  (Bolgheri)
description: A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot, this presents with aromas of black currant, green bell pepper and a whiff of cedar. The firm palate delivers blackberry, roasted coffee bean and black pepper alongside closed-grained tannins. Drink through 2022.

title: Campomaggio 2015  Chianti Classico
description: Aromas of ripe black cherry, plum, crushed mint and a whiff of baking spice carry over to the to the juicy palate along with a hint of licorice. It's savory and easygoing, with dusty tannins. Drink through 2020.

title: Carmel Road 2014 Drew's Blend Pinot Noir (Monterey)
description: Bright but wild on the nose, this bottling, which is overseen by actress Drew Barrymore, shows raspberry, thyme, sagebrush, rhubarb and smoke aromas on the inviting nose. The palate offers light berry flavors alongside hickory smoke, proving refreshing if not too complex.

title: Carmel Road 2014 First Row Pinot Noir (Arroyo Seco)
description: Dried red currants and cranberries meet with loamy soils on the nose of this block-designate bottling. Tangy red fruits and a hint of olive show on the palate, where the earthy minerality shines through the energetic acidity.

title: Casa Sola 2013 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)
description: Made with Sangiovese, 7% Cabernet Franc and 3% merlot, this offers aromas of black-skinned berry, blue flower and a hint of eucalyptus. The firm palate offers black-currant jam, star anise and espresso alongside polished tannins. Drink through 2022.

title: Casa Sola 2015  Chianti Classico
description: This easygoing red opens with aromas of red-skinned berry, violet and baking spice. The juicy, medium-bodied palate doles out red cherry, clove and white pepper alongside smooth tannins and fresh acidity. It's made to be enjoyed young so drink soon.

title: Delas Frères 2016 Les Challeys  (Saint-Joseph)
description: Buoyant strikes of honeysuckle, yellow peach and spice abound in this lavishly textured white wine. Soft, sunny acidity and swirls of cream and caramel accentuate its voluptuous style but the finish wraps up neatly on a pleasantly bitter note.

title: Domaine de Côtes Rémont 2016 Elevé en Fût de Chênes  (Chénas)
description: A small proportion of this producer's Chénas is aged in wood. The 12 months in wood gives extra richness as well as spice and toast, producing a full, structured wine that's likely to need aging. Drink from late 2018.

title: Domaine de Gry-Sablon 2016 Douby  (Morgon)
description: There are powerful tannins in this structured wine. Happily juicy red-fruit flavors and acidity cut through the tannins. Age the wine over the medium-term and drink from mid-2018.

title: Domaine de La Grume 2016 La Grume Grain d'Expression  (Brouilly)
description: A two-acre parcel of 70-year-old vines has produced this richly structured wine. With firm tannins and a dense texture, it is likely to age well over the coming few months. Drink from late 2018.

title: Domaine des Maisons Neuves 2016 L'Ecluse  (Côte de Brouilly)
description: From vines within sight of the winery, this wine is rich with generous tannins and bold red-cherry flavors. A good structure supports the bold, open fruitiness and acidity. Drink from late 2018.

title: Château de Nages 2015 Vieilles Vignes Red (Costières de Nîmes)
description: Firm, fine-grained tannins and hints of anise and dried herb lend savory appeal to this voluptuous red. Ripe black-cherry and plum flavors are succulent and plush in texture but balanced keenly with acidity. The finish is expansive and a touch warming.

title: Château de Valcombe 2015 Syrah-Grenache (Costières de Nîmes)
description: Deep veins of granite and crushed mineral penetrate through this ripe, juicy red full of concentrated blackberry and cassis flavors. This is a fleshy, forward wine but elegantly balanced with fresh acidity and firm, velvet-edged tannins.

title: Château du Trignon 2015 Red (Côtes du Rhône)
description: Hints of granite and moss lend nuance to lush, easy blueberry and blackberry flavors. This is a bold, voluptous wine but elegant, framed with velvet tannins and brisk acidic backbone.
